content.description: Start on left hand slopey crimp, right hand sloper and traverse through tough crimp moves and really bad rock quality that is very sharp and painful. Finish the same as Chossy Condies. I would not recommend this unless you ran out of other obed classics.
content.location: In the middle of the cave area boulder (section 21 in the guidebook)

content.description: Sit start on shelf and work your way up through crimps and jugs. I wasn't sure on the grade, could be harder or easier.
content.location: Very left of Cave Area boulder.

content.description: Start on really thin crimp seam with a bad left heal hook and work your way up and left to a tough top out.
content.protection: a couple of pads, it's not very tall
content.location: On the cave area boulder just to the left of Adverse Conditions (section 21 in the guidebook)

content.description:
This roof problem is unique for the Lilly Boulders.  Instead of the usual down-pulling holds, this problem is all about underclings.   

  Start with your left hand in a good, waist-high slot.  Move right to steep, blocky underclings in a roof.  Use kneebar technology to reach the next set of underclings and a tight crimp slot, then fire for a huge flat finishing hold.  Top out. 

  Would probably be V10 without kneepads.  Hard to find dry- hence the name.
content.protection: Two crash pads, and two kneepads.
content.location: On the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Despite being right off the trail, this overlooked boulder didn't make it into the new Obed guidebook.  The rock is great, the landing is perfect, and the caliber of problems is as good or better than what you find elsewhere at the Lilly Boulders.
